body.p: Edit your /etc/fstab and replace BOOT, ROOT and SWAP with the actual partition names. Don't forget to check that the file systems match your installation.
body.pre: livecd linux # cd /etc livecd etc # nano -w fstab /dev/sda1 /boot ext2 noauto,noatime 1 2 /dev/sda3 / ext3 noatime 0 1 /dev/sda2 none swap sw 0 0

body.p: Edit your /etc/fstab and replace BOOT, ROOT and SWAP with the actual partition names and add your logical volumes. Don't forget to check that the file systems match your installation.
body.pre: livecd linux # cd /etc livecd etc # nano -w fstab /dev/md1 /boot ext2 noauto,noatime 1 2 /dev/md3 / ext3 noatime 0 1 /dev/sda2 none swap sw,pri=1 0 0 /dev/sdb2 none swap sw,pri=1 0 0 /dev/vg/usr /usr ext3 noatime 1 2 /dev/vg/portage /usr/portage ext2 noatime 1 2 /dev/vg/distfiles /usr/portage/distfiles ext2 noatime 1 2 /dev/vg/home /home ext3 noatime 1 2 /dev/vg/opt /opt ext3 noatime 1 2 /dev/vg/tmp /tmp ext2 noatime 1 2 /dev/vg/var /var ext3 noatime 1 2 /dev/vg/vartmp /var/tmp ext2 noatime 1 2

body.p: Configure your network in /etc/conf.d/net. Add the net.eth0 init script to the default run level. If you have multiple NICs, symlink them to the net.lo init script and add them to the default run level as well. Don't forget to set your hostname too. Either edit /etc/conf.d/net and /etc/conf.d/hostname with nano or use the following commands:
body.pre: livecd etc # cd init.d livecd init.d # ln -s net.lo net.eth0 livecd init.d # cd ../conf.d livecd conf.d # echo 'config_eth0="192.168.1.10 netmask 255.255.255.0 brd 192.168.1.255"' >> net livecd conf.d # echo 'routes_eth0="default via 192.168.1.1"' >> net livecd conf.d # echo 'hostname="myhostname"' > hostname livecd conf.d # rc-update add net.eth0 default (If you compiled your network card driver as a module, add it to /etc/conf.d/modules livecd conf.d # echo 'modules="r8169"' >> /etc/conf.d/modules (If you want to reconnect via ssh after you have rebooted your new box) livecd conf.d # rc-update add sshd default
body.note: Emerge pcmciautils if you need support for PCMCIA cards.
body.p: Set the root password using passwd.
body.pre: livecd conf.d # passwd New UNIX password: type_the_password Retype new UNIX password: type_the_password_again passwd: password updated successfully
body.p: Check the system configuration in /etc/rc.conf and /etc/conf.d/keymaps and edit any of those files if required.
body.pre: livecd conf.d # nano -w /etc/rc.conf livecd conf.d # nano -w /etc/conf.d/keymaps
livecd conf.d # emerge mdadm lvm2 livecd conf.d # rc-update add mdraid boot livecd conf.d # rc-update add lvm boot

body.p: Install a system logger like syslog-ng and a cron daemon like vixie-cron, and add them to the default run level.
body.note: Cron daemons depend on an MTA. mail-mta/ssmtp will be pulled in as a dependency. If you want to use a more advanced MTA, you might want to install it now. If you are in a hurry, let ssmtp be installed and remove it later when you install the MTA of your choice.

pre.caption: Install a syslogger and a cron daemon

body.pre:
livecd conf.d # time emerge syslog-ng vixie-cron
real 1m54.099s user 1m2.630s sys 0m34.620s livecd conf.d # rc-update add syslog-ng default livecd conf.d # rc-update add vixie-cron default
body.p: Install the necessary file system tools (xfsprogs, reiserfsprogs or jfsutils) and networking tools (dhcpcd or ppp) if you need any.
body.pre: livecd conf.d # emerge xfsprogs (If you use the XFS file system) livecd conf.d # emerge jfsutils (If you use the JFS file system) livecd conf.d # emerge reiserfsprogs (If you use the Reiser file system) livecd conf.d # emerge dhcpcd (If you need a DHCP client) livecd conf.d # emerge ppp (If you need PPPoE ADSL connectivity)

body.p: Emerge grub and configure it. Do not forget to update the necessary boot parameters if you are using an initramfs.

pre.caption: Emerge grub and edit its configuration file

real 1m4.634s user 0m39.460s sys 0m15.280s livecd conf.d # nano -w /boot/grub/grub.conf
